channel.title: Tech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from Tech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Kara Swisher Would Rather Work for Sam Altman Than Mark Zuckerberg
item.description: But ideally, the journalist and podcast host would rather not work for tech CEOs at all.

item.title: WhatsApp launches long-awaited Apple Watch app
item.description: For the first time, WhatsApp users will be able to use their Apple Watch to get call notifications, read full messages, record and send voice messages...

item.title: Alexa+ comes to the Amazon Music app
item.description: Alexa+, Amazon's upgraded assistant powered by AI, is coming to the music streaming app for iOS and Android devices.

item.title: A New Type of Opioid Is Killing People in the US, Europe, and Australia
item.description: Nitazenes, a class of synthetic drugs 40 times more potent than fentanyl, are steadily becoming more common on both sides of the Atlantic.

item.title: What’s the Deal With Okapa’s $300 Water Bottle?
item.description: Eight years of research and 10,000 prototypes have created a luxury water bottle claiming to redefine the experience of drinking H2O, all for an eye-w...

item.title: Best Packing Cubes for Every Kind of Trip (2025), Tested and Reviewed
item.description: Whether you’re a no-frills backpacker or a bag-checking fashionista, there’s a perfect packing cube out there for you.

item.title: ClickUp adds new AI assistant to better compete with Slack and Notion
item.description: Core parts of the release were possible because of its acquisition of Qatalog.

item.title: Nvidia, Deutsche Telekom strike €1B partnership for a data center in Munich
item.description: Nvidia has signed a €1 billion partnership with Deutsche Telekom to set up an "AI factory" in Munich that aims to boost Germany's AI computing power b...

item.title: Crowdfunding giant GoFundMe now sells gift cards
item.description: GoFundMe is letting you gift nonprofit gift cards to loved ones to help them donate to their favorite organizations.

item.title: The Inside Story of How Gen Z Toppled Nepal’s Leader and Chose a New One on Discord
item.description: The revolution started on social media. It ended with protests, violence, and an online poll to pick the new prime minister.
